The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.

- Nelson Mandela

Emergency Help

If you or someone you care for is experiencing a mental health crisis and needs urgent care, please contact the following at your earliest opportunity:

Emergency Services

Call 999 if you are seriously ill or injured and your life is at risk. A mental health emergency should be taken as seriously as if you are physically hurt. Please seek support as soon as you can if you're feeling severely stressed, worried or anxious, not able to cope well or you do not feel in control.

Emergency GP Appointment

If you need urgent help for your mental health, you can make an emergency appointment with your GP, or alternatively you can contact NHS 111 online.

The Samaritans

Someone experiencing a mental health crisis should call Samaritans when they feel overwhelmed, in distress, or unable to cope. This includes moments of intense emotional pain, thoughts of self-harm, or suicidal feelings. Samaritans are available 24/7 to provide support and a listening ear.
